review_title: Super Excited to Work For a Rockstar Company, With Such Overall Employee Longevity !
job_title: Director of Nursing in Zephyrhills, FL
pros: My HR recruiter (Terra Hildebrant) is exceptional, knowledgeable, easy to converse with & just plain old down to earth! The regional corporate nursing team: (Cary Smith, Karen Robbins, Marie Fleurantin, are personable, seasoned, confident, timely, responsive & encouraging! ……And just to think, this is only the beginning of my new hire journey & I’m super impressed, excited about the future! I haven’t even started yet and I’m totally and wholeheartedly EXCITED! I haven’t felt this way in a very long time and I truly feel blessed in this moment to be given the opportunity to work for Advent Health in this capacity. YESSSSSSSS!!!!!
cons: At this moment, I have absolutely NO cons!

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Apopka, FL
pros: Alot of work (shifts) unless you tick off management or rub them the wrong way, then you won't get any work.
cons: Everything was a con. Having a minimum of 10 patients to 1 CNA. Skipping breaks on many days and staying later to chart because there's just soo much work. Pay was ridiculously low for the work.

pros: The organization is faith based and strive to keep faith as an anchor
cons: The nursing home environment is not the same as the hospital or doctor's office.

pros: Nice coworkers, good benefits, positive culture
cons: No room for growing and no raises

pros: They're awesome, the environment and energy is on a different level
cons: Pay is a bit low compared to what a medical professional's supposed to earn

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Hendersonville, NC
pros:
Over all environment is very pleasant and positive
Patient centered care
Company makes great effort to let you know you are appreciated
Great coworkers
cons:
Provider turn over, which then impacts the patients and staff
Didnt have the support of direct supervisor to use my nursing skills and abilities to their full extent

review_title: Nurse Manager for Float Pool is horrible
job_title: Registered Nurse, Float Pool in Merriam, KS
pros: Intelligent people work here, but unkind.
cons: Overworked, micro managed, and written up monthly for minor things w/ no gratitude or praise for job-well-done.

job_title: IT Support Specialist in Dallas, TX
pros: good management support with advancement opportunities
401k, Vision, Dental, Health are decent. The PDO accrual rate is excellent (4hrs for every week). Most employees generally care about their job.
cons: A shift in management recently has pushed older, more experienced employees out. Management doesn't have the back of the employees in the trenches. Departments have been short staffed for months, but no one cares. Instead you are chastised for falling behind in your work or working overtime to catch up on.

review_title: Great company to work for with great opportunities for advancement.
pros: Had to try really hard to collect from self-pay patients in the E.R. Good benefits and the Hospital Director was very nice but strict in the Admissions department. Had to reach a certain amount of collections of $10,000.00 dollars a month.
cons: unpaid breaks. food is not good at all.

job_title: Registered Nurse Cath Lab in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Good atmosphere , decent benefit and retirement package,  close to home
cons: None , I haven't found or encountered any problems working for advent

pros: Good benefits such as insurance, 401 k, incentive programs, and holidays off.
cons: Once hired pay raises minimum. Very hard to earn a decent living if started off at a entry level salary.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Tavares, FL
pros:
Mentally challenging
Pay
Anonymity
Respiratory department staff ( especially nightshift)
cons:
Old computer charting system
Patient load
A LOT of new grad nursing staff

pros: Great christian Health Care skilled nursing home to work for
cons: On call on weekends in my role

pros: Christian faith based community. Caring physicians
cons: They are very big on prayer

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Orlando, FL
pros: The people I work with are great
cons: The 8 hour shifts don’t pay enough

pros: Good nurses trying to make a difference
cons: Management doesn’t listen to staff, poor nurse patient ratios, poor work/life balance, management is more concerned with paperwork & patient surveys than patient care!
Deceptive about benefits, not living up to mission statement, changing schedule to other than what was agreed upon when hired, bully managers

All day meetings
Impossible to do your job
